qas.question: What is of the factors the capital cost of electrification system depends on?
How do some locomotives function in order to be more flexible in operation?

answers.text: can switch to different supply voltages

qas.question: What is the main disadvantage of railway electrification?
What are two types of revenue obtained through railway transportation?
What system supplies nuclear power to railway trains?
The same systems are used for both urban and intercity what?
All electric locomotives can switch to different supply voltages to allow for what?
A railway electrification system supplies power to trains and trams with an on-board what?

context: A <b4_0>railway electrification<b4_0/> system supplies electric power to railway trains and trams without an on-board <b8_0>prime mover<b8_0/> or local fuel supply. <b5_0>Electrification<b5_0/> has many advantages but requires <a2_0>significant capital expenditure<a2_0/>. Selection of an electrification system is based on economics of energy supply, <a0_0>maintenance<a0_0/>, and capital cost compared to the revenue obtained for <a3_0>freight and passenger traffic<a3_0/>. Different systems are used for urban and intercity <b6_0>areas<b6_0/>; some electric locomotives <a1_0>can switch to different supply voltages<a1_0/> to allow <b7_0>flexibility in operation<b7_0/>.
